physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Severe polyhydramnios (amniotic fluid index >35 cm) diagnosed at 19 weeks of gestation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Polyhydramnios recognized early in pregnancy, resolving spontaneously within 3 to 4 weeks in the infants who survived, leading to normal tubular and glomerular function at last follow-up.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Progressive polyuria developed in the infant, peaking at 140 ml/kg/hour immediately after birth.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Polyuria normalized within 1 week after birth.
